CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 19, 1950, pg. 21, reads: "Retains Crown - Ezzard Charles, NBA king of the heavyweights everywhere but in New York and England, retained his prized crown Tuesday night at Memorial Auditorium, Buffalo, N. Y., by handing the [illegible] but outclassed Freddie Behshore, a TKO defeat in the [ill.]teenth round of a scheduled fifteen-round 'chindig.'  Charles showed the effects of his long layoff, his timing not [ill.] up to par, but he had enough class to halt the challenger."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of boxer Ezzard Charles with fists raised in corner of boxing ring
